intro: Tylophora shikokiana, commonly known as the Shikokian tylophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Japan and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It produces distinctive berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
